comments.body: I think this will always be true? `use_auto_detect` is a bool, so it will always be `False` or `True`, never `None`... So the `else` section below should become a `elif` on the inner conditional?
'use_auto_detect' is not a must-have attribute, so if 'use_auto_detect' is not specified in the parameters, it will be None in "self.params".
Ah, i'd expect a bool to always be True/False, if that is not the case (no time to test really right now :)), then indeed, this needs to stay (and this goes for my other bool remarks)

`enable_3D` is a bool, so it will always be set, i think this can be a little simplified as well
```suggestion
        video_spec.device.enable3DSupport = self.params['enabled_3D']
        enabled_3d = self.params['enabled_3D']
        if self.params['enable_3D'] != video_card_facts['enable_3D_support']:
            self.change_detected = True
```
"enable_3D" is also not a must-have attribute. If it's not specified, "self.params['enable_3D']" will be None.
You are absolutely right :). Just did a quick test... sorry for my comment.
Thank you for your quick reviewing and checking:), I'll test a little bit more on vCenter and try to find a better way to handle that "float 1.172" value issue above. Thanks a lot.
